intro: Achyranthes nervosa, commonly known as the veined spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, alternate leaves. Its flowers are clustered in cyathia, which are cup-like structures that house the reproductive organs. Achyranthes nervosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
